[vc_row row_content_width=”grid” css=”.vc_custom_1588614700672{padding-top: 150px !important;padding-bottom: 149px !important;}” simple_background_color=”#ffffff”][vc_column][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner]

Let Us Help

Frequently Asked Questions

[vc_empty_space height=”30px”][vc_column_text]

Whether you are looking to transform back to your “pre-mom” body, or simply ready to take the step into sculpting your dream body – Bodyful Toronto is here to help. Below is a list of answers to some of our frequently asked questions, for more information please give us a call or email.

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”55px”][vc_column_text]

Click any question to view Our Answers

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”55px”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_empty_space height=”30px”]

What can I expect after having had non-invasive treatments?
[vc_column_text]

  • Non-invasive procedures to remove excess fat involve minimal recovery time; patients can resume their normal activities the same day.
  • Non-invasive therapies typically require multiple treatment sessions.
  • Patients will observe a visible decrease in fat bulges after 5-10 sessions.

[/vc_column_text]

What are the potential complications of non-invasive treatments?
[vc_column_text]

  • Redness in treated area lasting no more than a few hours.
  • Localized bruising that usually clears within a few hours.

[/vc_column_text]

Who is not a candidate for non-invasive treatments?
[vc_column_text]Patients with unrealistic expectations regarding the outcome of the procedure are not good candidates for non-invasive treatments. Likewise, people who regard non-invasive removal of excess fat as a substitute for proper diet and exercise also are not good candidates. Patients with pacemakers, defibrillators or aneurysms are not candidates for radiofrequency treatment.[/vc_column_text]
Are non-invasive treatments painful?
[vc_column_text]The treatments are well tolerated by most patients. On occasion, a burning sensation may be felt[/vc_column_text]
When are non-invasive treatments appropriate?
[vc_column_text]Non-invasive treatments are appropriate for excess fat removal and body contouring with proper patient expectations.[/vc_column_text]
What should first be done before considering non-invasive treatments?
[vc_column_text]Before the procedure, a trained specialist will review the patient’s medical history. This is the time for specialist and the patient to discuss expectations, potential risks and outcomes of the procedure. Patients should understand that there are not yet any long-term studies on these procedures and that there is no guarantee regarding their effectiveness. However, we guarantee a visible improvement if at home instructions are followed.[/vc_column_text]
[vc_empty_space height=”30px”][vc_column_text]

*Results and patient experience vary. This site is for informational purposes only. It is not to be used or relied on for medical, diagnostic, or treatment purposes. It is not intended as patient education. Info should not be used as a substitute for professional opinion.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row row_content_width=”grid” css=”.vc_custom_1588709087776{padding-top: 107px !important;padding-bottom: 94px !important;}” parallax_background_image=”4151″][vc_column offset=”vc_col-lg-offset-2 vc_col-lg-8″][vc_row_inner content_text_aligment=”center”][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]

Reshape Your Body

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”24px”][vc_column_text]

Body Sculpting Treatments Customized Personally For You

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”24px”] BOOK NOW [/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]
